item.title: Developing in golang with Nix package manager
item.description: I’ve been using Go since several months. It’s a pleasant language, even though it has its own drawbacks. In our Nixpkgs repositoryÂ we have support for several programming languages: perl, python, ruby, haskell, lua, … We’ve merged a better support for Go. What kind of support are we talking about? In Nix, you never install libraries. Instead, you define an environment in which to use a certain library compiled for a certain version of the language.
